sentence.value: Henry Charles Gordon (December 23, 1925 - September 24, 1996) was an American astronaut and a colonel in the United States Air Force.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Henry Charles Gordon|Henry_C._Gordon]] (December 23, 1925 - [[September|September]] 24, 1996) was [[an American astronaut|The_American_Astronaut]] and [[a colonel|Colonel]] in [[the United States Air Force|United_States_Air_Force]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Henry Charles Gordon|Henry_C._Gordon]] (December 23, 1925 - September 24, 1996) was an American astronaut and a colonel in [[the United States Air Force|United_States_Air_Force]].

sentence.value: He worked on the Boeing X-20 Dyna-Soar program.
sentence.annotated-sentence: He worked on the [[Boeing X-20 Dyna-Soar|Boeing_X-20_Dyna-Soar]] program.

sentence.value: Gordon was born in Valparaiso, Indiana.
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Gordon was born in Valparaiso, Indiana.

sentence.value: In 1950 he earned his bachelors degree in aeronautical engineering from Purdue University, and in 1966 he earned his masters degree in business administration from the University of Southern California.

sentence.value: Gordon was in the Air Force, and flew combat missions in the Korean and Vietnam wars.
sentence.annotated-sentence: Gordon was in [[the Air Force|Air_force]], and flew [[combat missions|Combat_Missions]] in the Korean and [[Vietnam|Vietnam_War]][[Vietnam wars|Vietnam_War]].

sentence.value: He was selected as an astronaut in the X-20 Dyna-Soar program in April 1962 and began training at the Air Force Flight Test Center, Edwards Air Force Base, California.

sentence.value: He retired as an astronaut when the Dyna-Soar program was cancelled on December 10, 1963, having never flown in space.
sentence.annotated-sentence: He retired as [[an astronaut|Astronaut]] when the [[Dyna-Soar|Boeing_X-20_Dyna-Soar]] program was cancelled on December 10, 1963, having never flown in [[space|Space]].
